content.rendered:
Photo by Minimography

This Week in Genesis (#25) there’s no one ‘big’ Genesis story, just a whole lot of awesome, including: a free theme, some extremely good looking theme teases, amazing showcase work, and some fine tutorials.

In fact it’s one of our most packed weeks ever.

Themes

Jeffrey Carandang is giving away a copy of his Wander theme if you sign up to his newsletter.

Here's a #free #genesiswp Child Theme, originally premium & I've decided to give it for free this month https://t.co/swc3qiqJ5X #wordpress

— Jeffrey Carandang (@phpbits) November 4, 2015

Brian Gardner with another tease of his forthcoming No Sidebar theme.

No Sidebar theme teaser — https://t.co/mONsxtq8MH #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) October 30, 2015

Tease of the new Forest theme, coming out of WPStudio.

Working on Forest, a new Genesis theme. As promised hereby another screenshot. https://t.co/B6fSYBfl4T #genesiswp #wordpress #webdesign

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) November 5, 2015

And finally, a tease of a new Genesis theme from the guys over at Simple Pro Themes.

Fresh, Bright & Crisp Genesis child theme – coming soon @ https://t.co/GDGEUavCyd #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/V6AELu8cMg

— Simple Pro Themes (@SimpleProThemes) November 5, 2015

Showcase

First up this week, Susan Ramsey with a great implementation of StudioPress’ Workstation Pro theme for her own site, onehappystudio.com

A revamp of my website using #WorkstationPro makes navigating the site easier for visitors. https://t.co/B2MXeSOcIh #GenesisWP

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) November 2, 2015

Great redesign from Erin Ulrich for thisreadingmama.com

Loved working on this redesign for @thisreadingmama … https://t.co/zb6umfDySN #genesiswp

— Erin Ulrich (@erinulrich) October 30, 2015

Christiana Aramso with a new site for bamboo-apartments.com

https://t.co/8QaMoKMLeZ Bespoke #WordPress child theme with Genesis and perspiration (first time) #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/ph7Oxxyxy6

— Christina Arasmo (@dropsoul) November 3, 2015

And finally that man Brian Gardner with another new design for his personal site, briangardner.com

Oops, I did it again — https://t.co/ImCnCwfYWv

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) November 3, 2015

Podcasts

First up, over on the UK Genesis podcast, regular hosts Jo Waltham and Gary Jones chat to Dom Wint.

We're live! @CleanPageDesign #genesiswp #ukgenesis https://t.co/wMIW23jHGV pic.twitter.com/Ydh6p6OeQs

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) November 4, 2015

Meanwhile, over on OfficeHours.fm, Carrie Dils speaks to Tom McFarlin about Genesis, accessibility…

I am LIVE with @tommcfarlin! Watch here: https://t.co/gVekN3AjqO r here https://t.co/gVekN3AjqO Tag your questions with #officefm

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) November 5, 2015

…and ‘that’ t-shirt / wall colour combo.

@officehoursfm #officefm Did it take you long to find a t-shirt that matched the exact same colour as your wall?

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) November 5, 2015

Best of the rest

As well as an updated site design, Brian Gardner’s also been adding some new Genesis tutorials to his site.

Looking for Genesis Tutorials? Bookmark this —> https://t.co/s6OJO2utEL #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) November 3, 2015

Meanwhile, there are lot of encouraging Genesis noises coming from the direction of Calvin Koepke…

Friday Tease: I’m bringing something back. #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Necmb482Su

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) October 30, 2015

Cleaning up blog post archives. Rewriting tutorials. Refining categories. Adding downloads. Subscribed? #genesiswp https://t.co/aclhVK7Nj3

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) November 4, 2015

Sneak peak on some of the things I'm revamping on my site. This and more, coming soon… #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/BdAcm2cEGk

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) November 5, 2015

Another sneak peek at the upcoming relaunch of my website. Signed up? https://t.co/aclhVK7Nj3 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/QWgX392HCY

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) November 6, 2015

Neil Gee shares a useful tutorial on positioning Genesis Simple Share icons with WooCommerce Products and Shop pages.

Position Genesis Simple Share Icons in WooCommerce Products and Shop Page #genesiswp #woocommerce https://t.co/HDlWWVdS1f

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) October 31, 2015

Sridhar Katakam with three new (free) tutorials on:

  • using the Customizer API to add settings for header backgrounds in Genesis,
  • how to replace the static Front page in Minimum Pro with Posts page and
  • How to make Posts page obey its Page layout setting in Genesis.

How to use Customizer API to add settings for Header background in #GenesisWP: https://t.co/QzLowShiwk pic.twitter.com/gUKu8dBrnQ

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) November 3, 2015

How to replace the static Front page in Minimum Pro with Posts page #GenesisWP https://t.co/ymlGf3hf7y pic.twitter.com/Y1sRQ9oepj

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) November 4, 2015

How to make Posts page obey its Page layout setting in Genesis #GenesisWP https://t.co/Q8bJoqRq3m pic.twitter.com/kIDaAp3zDw

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) November 6, 2015

Slides from two Genesis related presentations at the Philly ‘burbs WordPress meetup by John Lauber (‘Genesis Resources’) and Sal Ferrarello (‘Hooked on Genesis’).

Here's my slides for tonight's @burbswp Meetup on Genesis resources. https://t.co/QqiYAH32Aj #genesiswp

— JohnLauber (@JohnLauber) November 3, 2015

My slides from @burbswp tonight on #genesiswp https://t.co/1uLAjUXpjz

— Sal Ferrarello (@salcode) November 3, 2015

A new plugin, Hero for Genesis Framework, is released byJeffrey Carandang. And if you’d like to give Jeffrey feedback you can do so over on this thread over at the Genesis WordPress Facebook group (you must be a member).

New #WordPress plugin: "Hero for Genesis Framework" https://t.co/u9jgNnRpJR Easiest and Powerful way to add header, hero image & content t…

— newest wp plugins (@new_wp_plugins) November 6, 2015

And finally, if you want to know more about the forthcoming UK Genesis retreat, give Jo Waltham a shout.

If you want to know more about the #UKGenesis #GenesisWP retreat please DM me your email address & I'll add you to the email list.

— Jo Waltham (@JoWaltham) November 2, 2015

That’s all for this week.

But if you have a comment, suggestion (or complaint) don’t hesitate to leave a comment below, where it will be displayed for all time alongside this fabulous round-up.

Until next time…

PS The winner of last week’s Musket competition was Nathan Briggs. Congrats Nathan!
